contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = Vladan Batić<br>Владан Батић | honorific-suffix = | image =Vladan Batić MC.jpg | order = | office = [[Minister of Justice (Serbia)|Minister of Justice]] | term_start = 25 January 2001 | term_end = 3 March 2004 | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | predecessor= | successor=[[Zoran Stojković]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1949|7|27}} | birth_place = [[Obrenovac]], [[People's Republic of Serbia|PR Serbia]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2010|12|29|1949|7|27}} | death_place = [[Obrenovac]], [[Serbia]] | nationality = | spouse = | party = [[Christian Democratic Party of Serbia]] | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Belgrade Faculty of Law|Belgrade Law School]] | occupation = | profession = | religion = | signature = | website = }} '''Vladan Batić''' ({{lang-sr|Владан Батић}}; 27 July 1949 – 29 December 2010)<ref name=B92>{{cite news|title=Ex-justice minister and MP dies|url=http://www.b92.net/eng/news/politics-article.php?yyyy=2010&mm=12&dd=29&nav_id=71826|accessdate=31 December 2010|newspaper=B92 News|date=29 December 2010}}</ref> was a [[Serbia]]n politician. He graduated from the [[University of Belgrade]]'s [[University of Belgrade Faculty of Law|Law School]]. He was the Minister of Justice in the [[Government of Serbia|Serbian Government]] from 2000 to 2003. It 2001, Batić announced that warrants would be made for the arrests of former persons in power before the [[Bulldozer Revolution|5 October]] uprising of 2000 who were suspected of misconduct through abuse of power. It was this campaign which eventually led to the surrender of [[Slobodan Milošević]] to police as an alternative to forced arrest,{{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} and the first step to his extradition to [[The Hague]]. In 2004 he ran for Serbian Presidency in the [[Serbian presidential election, 2004|election]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://unpan1.un.org/intradoc/groups/public/documents/untc/unpan017168.pdf | format=pdf | title=International Election Observation Mission Republic of Serbia (Serbia and Montenegro) Presidential Election Second Round, 27 June 2004 | date=28 June 2004 | location=Belgrade | author=OSCE/ODIHR/Council of Europe | publisher=United Nations | accessdate=31 December 2010}}</ref> At the time of his death Batić was the President of the [[Christian Democratic Party of Serbia]] and since 2007 a Member of Parliament as a part of his party's bloc formed with their coalition partner the [[Liberal Democratic Party (Serbia 2005)|Liberal Democratic Party]]. Batić reappeared in international news media spotlight when he testified before a [[Nicosia]] court that billions of dollars belonging to the [[Serbia]] had been smuggled out of the country by the ousted [[Slobodan Milošević|Milošević]] administration during the [[United Nations|UN]] [[International sanctions|sanctions]] on the country, by use of offshore corporations in [[Cyprus]] registered by the former law office of the [[Greek Cypriots|Greek Cypriot]] leader, [[Tassos Papadopoulos]]. Batić had been pursuing the affair since 2002.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.cyprus-mail.com/cyprus/taking-serbian-people-ride | archiveurl=http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:lRaPA_lr1V0J:www.cyprus-mail.com/cyprus/taking-serbian-people-ride | archivedate=16 November 2010 | first=Loucas | last=Charalambous | title=Taking the Serbian people for a ride | date=12 March 2006 | newspaper=[[Cyprus Mail]] | accessdate=31 December 2010 }}</ref> Batić died on 29 December 2010 from [[throat cancer]].<ref name=B92 /> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2011}} {{commons category|Vladan Batić}} {{Authority control|VIAF=67649282}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Batic, Vladan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Serbian politician, Minister of Justice | DATE OF BIRTH =27 July 1949 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Obrenovac]], [[SR Serbia]], [[Yugoslavia]] | DATE OF DEATH =29 December 2010 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Obrenovac]], [[Serbia]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Batic, Vladan}} [[Category:1949 births]] [[Category:2010 deaths]] [[Category:People from Obrenovac]] [[Category:Christian Democratic Party of Serbia politicians]] [[Category:University of Belgrade Faculty of Law alumni]] [[Category:Members of Orthodox political parties]] [[Category:Deaths from esophageal cancer]] [[Category:Cancer deaths in Serbia]] {{Serbia-politician-stub}}
